newsitem.title: FRANCE: Press rights group asks Ethiopia to free newsmen.
newsitem.headline: Press rights group asks Ethiopia to free newsmen.

text.p: A Paris-based international press rights group called on Ethiopia on Friday to release several jailed newsmen, saying prison was not the right answer to media offences.

Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said in a letter to Prime Minister Meles Zenawi that it failed to understand why Sinteyehu Abate, editor-in-chief of the weekly Remet, had not been released though several weeks ago he ended a year's jail term for publishing material and a photograph thought pornographic.
RSF said four other newsmen were also being held in prison for reasons which were not known. It said "prison sentences are never an appropriate response to press offences".

The group identified the jailed newsmen as Wesson Seged Mersha, publisher of the weekly Kitab; Goshu Modus of the weekly and monthly Tobia and acting manager of the weekly Tikuret; Tilahun Bekele, editor-in-chief of the weekly Ruhama, and Tefera Kitila, editor-in-chief of the weekly Tikuret.
All the publications are in Amharic.
RSF said nine other journalists, which it did not name, were also in jail in Ethiopia, some for more than a year awaiting trial.
